results.title: Chasing Buddha
results.creator_credit: Amiel Courtin-Wilson, Julie Stone, Film Victoria, Go>Group, Halo and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Compelling and informative, “Chasing Buddha” is a biographical documentary about Robina Courtin, a highly energetic, outrageous, radical feminist, lesbian Australian Buddhist nun. Born one of seven children and raised as a Catholic, Robina candidly tells of her journey from childhood through to her teens and adult life and of the uncontained energy that drove her into becoming a political activist and radical feminist during the 70s, and finally the “accidental” path which lead her to Buddhism and to her Llama. Loud, enigmatic, charismatic, this amazing woman spends most of her time in the United States where she runs an international magazine, Mandala, teaches and councils students in Buddhism and visits prisoners on life sentences or on death row offering them spiritual guidance and the teachings of Buddha. Totally committed in her beliefs but not afraid to be outspoken or even confrontational, Robina has won the hearts of many and is highly respected wherever she goes. Includes narratives by family and friends, stills, home movies and archival footage. Director Amiel Courtin-Wilson, Robina’s nephew, was nominated in the AFI Awards (2000) for Best Direction in a Documentary.

results.title: Charlie needs a cloak
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Charlie is a shepherd. He has a cosy house, a big hat, a crook, a flock of fat sheep - and a tattered cloak. In the springtime, Charlie decides to make himself a new red cloak. He shears his sheep and fashions his new garment from the wool. This animated film, sparked by a whimsical Italian tarantella musical score, follows the process of making woollen cloth into clothing with charm and wry humour. The conclusion will delight - and not altogether surprise - the young viewer. Written and animated by Tomie de Paola from his book of the same name.

results.brief_description: In the “Fireman”, Charlie Chaplin stars as a lazy and inefficient fireman.(1916). Also features “Caught in a Cabaret” (1914). Rated: G

results.title: Charlie Chaplin: The Adventurer/the Cure
results.brief_description: Charles Chaplin was born on April 6, 1889 in South London of not so successful music hall entertainers. At the age of eight he joined a variety act called “The Eight Lancashire Lads” and worked all over England and parts of Europe throughout his childhood. He toured America in 1910-11 and returned to that country again in 1912 to 1913 where he was seen by Mack Sennett and joined the Keystone company for $150 per week. This cassette features: “The Cure” (1917) and “The Adventurer” (1917).

results.title: Charley says. Vol. 01
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Video Network
results.brief_description: Presented here is a collection of over seventy Public Information Films that were made between 1959-1975. All the favourite animated characters are here: Charley the ginger moggy whose safety-conscious nature is a perfect companion for the kids, Jo and Petunia the environmentally unfriendly picnickers and Tufty the animated puppet squirrel who gets mum to help him across the road. This collection of colourful and varied animations were a big part of the 70’s culture (especially) and helped disseminate a range of community, health and safety messages. This large collection helps encapsulate the values of its day and helps to illustrate the changing values within our society.

results.title: Chardin and the female image (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Kafno, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Examines the paintings of Chardin in relation to the tradition of portraying the female image, and compares his work to that of contemporaries such as Fragonard, Watteau, Boucher and Greuze

results.title: Character make-up: youth & age
results.brief_description: This program deals with character make-up, youth and age. Laura Bradish demonstrates the application of character make-up as a young actress is transformed into an old woman.

results.title: Chapelcross: Scotland's first nuclear power station
results.brief_description: Shows features of the construction of Chapelcross nuclear power station - the first to be built in Scotland. Presented in a style suitable for non-technical audiences, concentrating on the civil engineering work involved in the construction. Scenes of the official opening ceremony are also included.

results.title: Channelling baby
results.creator_credit: Christine Parker, Caterina De Nave, New Zealand Film Commission and Oceania Parker Films
results.brief_description: 1971—New Zealand soldiers are heading off to Vietnam amidst hordes of peace protesters and the heady excitement of a solar eclipse. In a column of soldiers stopped to board a military truck, Geoff catches sight of Bunnie, a beautiful hippy whose glorious, intimate smile is the lasting vision he takes with him to war. Destiny brings the pair together a second time, when Geoff returns from Vietnam a few months later. Each has been badly hurt in different ways, but in spite of their personal damage, they fall instantly and passionately in love. They start a life together and Bunnie gives birth to a baby girl. Their lives should be joyously complete, but one day, Geoff and the baby mysteriously disappear, leaving Bunnie devastated. Years later, in the 1990s, Bunnie accepts help from Cassandra, a young woman who claims to be a clairvoyant, to find out what has become of her child. Cassandra brings the couple back together again to solve the mystery of what really happened. Their memories are startlingly different, but pieced together, the truth emerges, bringing escalating consequences. Cast includes Danielle Cormack, Kevin Smith, Amber Sainsbury and Joel Tobeck.

results.title: Changing the record
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Examines the effects of major technological change in the newspaper industry. The issues raised have important implications for industrial relations in other industries facing technological change
